term.title: aminoxyl radicals

item.text: Compounds having the structure R2N–O.R2N.+–O−; they are radicals derived from hydroxylamines by removal of the hydrogen atom from the hydroxy group, and are in many cases isolable. The synonymous terms 'nitroxyl radicals' and 'nitroxides' erroneously suggest the presence of a nitro group; their use is not desirable. E.g. (ClCH2)2N–O. bis(chloromethyl)aminoxyl.
